name: NBCNews
text: @NBCBLK Black voters are expected to vote for Joe Biden over Pres. Trump by about an 80-point margin, polling estimates indicate. But political analysts say Black voters over age 65 in particular are expected to play a pivotal role in deciding Biden's fate. https://t.co/OP8av6HRcg (2/7) https://t.co/Nx3Zv3CKNY

name: NBCNews
text:
@NBCBLK Biden also holds a dominant lead in the Black LGBTQ community, polls show.

In fact, Trump may have lost in 2016 if votes in battleground states from the Black and LGBTQ communities had come in at higher rates — and if more were registered to vote. https://t.co/TsIEvu0pf0 (3/7) https://t.co/B4650c0NUl

name: NBCNews
text:
RT @GeoffRBennett: The White House on lockdown: A federal law enforcement source tells NBC that beginning tomorrow, crews will build a “non-scalable” fence to secure the WH complex, Ellipse and Lafayette Square.

250 National Guardsmen have been put on standby, reporting to Metro Police officials.The White House on lockdown: A federal law enforcement source tells NBC that beginning tomorrow, crews will build a… https://t.co/khCvT09Qi5

name: NBCNews
text: @NBCBLK Black officers who spoke with @NBCNews say this year’s vote is a personal referendum on their career and they’ll have to consider the ways citizens interact with police right now, as well as calls to overhaul policing and address racism more broadly. https://t.co/mRZESwXPZX (5/7) https://t.co/vDcUO8AEIG

name: NBCNews
text:
@NBCBLK There have always been Black conservatives and Republicans. In the Trump era, being one is a balancing act.

"We say that Blacks aren't monolithic, but then we want 100% of Blacks to vote for, you know, that's just not how any of this works." https://t.co/HdHpUyOBMn (6/7) https://t.co/0VL3Sb2aO7
